channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple’s $100 Billion Secret: AI Gets the Hype, Services Still Bring in the Money
item.description: Apple’s Services business is as strong as ever, but that might be a problem.

item.title: The surprising power of interim CEOs
item.description: In the defining years of American business, founding CEOs were virtually synonymous with the companies they led. Walt Disney was Disney incarnate; Dal...

item.title: Why This AI Company Just Stopped Minors From Using Its Chatbots
item.description: Character.AI is the latest to scrutinize who can use the platform—or how AI handles sensitive issues.

item.title: Since ChatGPT launched, job openings have plunged 30% while the stock market has surged 70%—but one economist says the true culprit isn’t AI
item.description: It's been called "the scariest chart in the world."

item.title: A New Forecast Sees Less Seasonal Holiday Hiring This Year. Here’s Why
item.description: A Challenger Gray & Christmas report predicts the lowest rate of year-end hiring since 2009.

item.title: The fascinating story behind the 2025 NYC marathon medal
item.description: Few objects embody the endurance of the human spirit better than a medal. This Sunday, when the projected 55,000 breathless souls cross the finishing ...

item.title: Bill Gates is just plain wrong about climate change
item.description: Bill Gates has invested billions over the last two decades to help fight climate change. But in a new blog post , he argues that world is too focused ...

item.title: Barry’s ‘cofounder’ unwinds at his own gym—but even he admits balance is elusive: ‘Many days I have to wake up and choose who I’m going to disappoint’
item.description: Barry’s chair went from joining the gym at 26 to running it—now, he still wears athletic wear to work, has the same lunch every day, and spends $2.70 ...

item.title: Why multitasking is sabotaging your career—and how to stop
item.description: Research is clear that multitasking significantly undermines career progress despite its popularity in modern workplaces. But why does multitasking ha...

item.title: Companies are trying to do too much with AI, says IT CEO: ‘Pick one or two domains and go end to end’
item.description: The key extracting ROI from gen AI projects is to choose your lane—and stay there.

item.title: To Build a Successful Brand, Don’t Neglect This Part of the Customer Experience
item.description: By integrating data security into the customer experience, brands can achieve a competitive edge.

item.title: The government shutdown won’t be completely recouped—and it could cost the economy up to $14 billion, estimates say
item.description: The report says lost goods and services from furloughed workers’ downtime won’t be regained once the government reopens.

item.title: Scared you might lose your job to AI? How managers can survive the AI purge
item.description: The news that Microsoft is making 9,000 workers redundant this year, with a focus on jettisoning managers, has sent ripples through the business world...

item.title: Billie Eilish calls on billionaires to give away their wealth—with Mark Zuckerberg in the room: ‘If you’re a billionaire, why are you one?’
item.description: "No hate, but yeah, give your money away, shorties,” she said at the WSJ Magazine Innovator Awards.

item.title: How Thinking Locally Can Help You Build Your Personal Brand
item.description: If you want to increase your influence, start by connecting with the people around you.
